channel.title: DOOM 3 BFG Edition... save your money!
channel.description:
I'm a big fan of id Studios and have almost all of their published titles. I've been playing the original Doom 3, heavily modded (SikkMod & Wulfen Textures) and it looks and sounds fantastic, even for an 8-year old game.
Just got DOOM 3 BFG Edition (BFGE) for PC and what a huge disappointment!!! I never thought or expected that this new release would be so consolized. The video options consist of Resolution, FPS (60 or 120), Vsync, Anti-aliasing Level (off, x2, x4) and Blur Level... that's it! There are NO audio settings available at all. According to info stated by Tim Willits, id Studios Creative Director, in numerous interviews since the title was announced last May, BFGE was to get the following:
"HD" treatment - NOT! Same blurry environment textures. Rework of NPC models - NOT! Same multi-pointed heads. Improved sounds - NOT! Muffled and crackly audio. Game Engine Optimizations - NOT! Stuttering and choppiness (I'm playing it on a very hi-end SLI-enabled computer).
Seems all the HD treatments have been applied to the console versions of BFGE, in particular for Playstation hardware that's never had the Doom series available to it.
Add to all this that no existing DOOM 3 community mods can be used with BFGE, because it incorporates certain technology from their newer id Tech 5 engine, that was used for Rage. John Carmack from id is still trying to figure out a way to resolve this issue, hopefully soon.
It's a shame that id has sold-out and royally screwed their long standing PC supporters, as has been the case with some other PC-only studios that have migrated their titles to consoles. id did it with Rage and now they've done it with DOOM 3. Let's hope DOOM 4 is not in jeopardy, as well.
Guess the only real bright spot with BFGE is the "Lost Mission" pack, which I haven't started yet. There's now little motivation to do so, knowing that it will consist of blurry textures, multi-pointed heads, muffled-crackly audio and frame stuttering... geez, I can hardly wait?
Save your money... don't support a crap release like this!!!

item.title: DOOM 3 BFG Edition... save your money!
item.dc:creator: Lemonz_amp_amp_orang
item.description:
Maxx Skywalker:

Therefore it’s not a remake, simply an HD upscaling.

A few examples of remakes:

  1. Black Mesa: A remake because they made everything from scratch with more detail than the original, in a completely different engine.

  2. Bionic Commando: Rearmed: A remake because they made everything from scratch by implementing fully polygonal environments, with more detail than the original.

  3. Super Mario All-Stars: Three remakes on one cartridge that implemented entirely different sprites, with much more detail than their NES counterparts.

  4. The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time 3D/Starfox 64 3D: Practically the same games as the N64 originals, but with all new models and textures. Still qualified as remakes.

Doom 3 BFG Edition does not fit any of those qualities as the textures are the same. It’s a rerelease that takes advantage of the upscaling, that this generation’s hardware allows for, from whatever the native resolution was initially.

they’ve done that with every source port they make for consoles to come…

i guarantee you doom will be ported and ported and ported for every console, until the industry dies (i am speaking of the old ones, not the new)
as for pc, get a dosbox or optimize a source port yourself…
or if you are lazy download the GOG fixes

item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I posted this in the screenshot thread but I’ll do it here too.

Go into your folders and open DoomConfig.cfg. Now go through and look for:

seta com_videoRam “2048”

seta image_downSizeLimit “0”
seta image_ignoreHighQuality “0”
seta image_downSizeBumpLimit “0”
seta image_downSizeSpecularLimit “0”
seta image_downSizeBump “0”
seta image_downSizeSpecular “0”

And maybe a few other variables around that area. Some of them are probably wrong. I know that my video ram was set to something negative and most of the second part for me were 1’s.

item.title: DOOM 3 BFG Edition... save your money!
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
xalener:

It’s an HD remake because the console version is rendered in HD now

This. In the MGS HD collection, they touched almost nothing from Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance, and put it on the PS3/Xbox 360. There were a few textures that they did touch (Guns Of Patriots on the first door you go through as Raiden) but those are in the minority. I’m assuming MGS3: Subsistence was the same. (minus MGO not being there)

Same with Ratchet & Clank HD, I didn’t notice any textures or effects that weren’t there in the PS2 originals.

All too often people confuse HD rereleases as remakes. If they keep everything the same aside from the odd bug, texture, etc. here and there, it’s not a remake. See Resident Evil on the PS1, then look at it on the GameCube. That’s a completely different game. Doom 3 BFG is the same game.

Back on topic, I’ve just installed some mods (haven’t edited CGFs to fully enable them yet) and, well, I think I have a problem.

The starting cutscene looked fine until the camera moved away from the monitor :fffuuu:
Gonna try and fix this tomorrow.
